docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14-- President Johnson announced tonight that he would appoint Thomas C. Mann, the Ambassador to Mexico, as Assistant Secretary of State for Latin-American Affairs. Mr. Mann will have wide authority to coordinate political and...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Dec. 14-- President Johnson announced tonight that he would appoint Thomas C. Mann, the Ambassador to Mexico, as Assistant Secretary of State for Latin-American Affairs. Mr. Mann will have wide authority to coordinate political and economic policy in that area.
docs.abstract: apptmt of Amb Mann as Asst State Sec for Latin-Amer Affairs seen Johnson Adm move to coordinate Alliance programs

docs.lead_paragraph: THOMAS CLIFTON MANN, who was named yesterday to be special White House adviser on inter-American affairs, likes to think of himself as a Texas country lawyer, but for the last 20 years he has served the State Department in a variety of posts far removed from Texas court houses.
